intro: Moniera graveolens, commonly known as the stink weed, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae and is characterized by its small, fragrant flowers that emit a strong, unpleasant odor. The plant has dark green, opposite leaves and produces small, yellowish fruits that contain seeds. It is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and along stream banks. Due to its pungent scent, it is sometimes used in traditional medicine for its purported antiseptic properties.
